div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2093 Catania, before 1885 (216) Burial: c. 405 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: AV Acragas Camarina or Catana (KA) Gela Syracuse Disposition: dispersed Sambon, F.P.L. 248 (1885), p. 20; 206 (1903), p. 11 Jenkins, Gela, pp. 148-9 Of two AV of Acragas at Syracuse (M. T. Currò Pisanò, AIIN 1962-4, p. 221, s.v. Sortino, before 1889), one has a hd. provenance arid is probably from this find. The other may be a stray find from Sortino (about 30 km. NW of Syracuse), unless indeed this hd. was actually found at Sortino and only marketed at Catania. Jenkins notes the existence in private possession in England of 1 Acragas, 1 KA, and 4 Syracuse, which may also derive from this hd.
